item.title: Coronavirus: Dominic Cummings rejects calls to quit as PM's chief adviser
item.description: Dominic Cummings is accused of flouting lockdown rules by making a 260-mile trip to be near relatives.

item.title: Coronavirus: France reveals reciprocal quarantine plans for UK arrivals
item.description: Travellers to France must self-isolate for 14 days, following similar measures announced by the UK.

item.title: Pakistan plane crash survivor: 'All I could see was fire'
item.description: At least 97 people have died after a plane hit a Karachi residential area as it tried to land.

item.title: Blackburn shooting: Five charged with Aya Hachem murder
item.description: They are also charged with attempting to murder a man police believe was the intended target.

item.title: Coronavirus: Nurse 'hasn't hugged son, two, in five weeks'
item.description: She isolated from her two-year-old boy after Covid-19 was confirmed at her workplace.

item.title: Coronavirus: Concern at delay to drive-through test booking
item.description: People in Wales still cannot book coronavirus tests via a UK-wide portal used by the other nations.

item.title: Wareham Forest fire flare-ups continue to spread after six days
item.description: Fire crews say 45mph winds are proving a "huge risk" to the fire which has been burning for six days.

item.title: Coronavirus: Anti-lockdown car protest draws thousands
item.description: An opposition party urges people to protest from their cars in order to maintain social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Government pledges Â£283m for buses and trams
item.description: But the transport secretary says social distancing will cut capacity to a fifth of the usual amount.

item.title: Hana Kimura: Netflix star and Japanese wrestler dies at 22
item.description: The wrestler turned Netflix Reality TV personality had posted about online bullying before she died.

item.title: Australia release rugby trio after virus pay row
item.description: Rugby Australia and Queensland Rugby Union release Queensland Reds trio Izack Rodda, Harry Hockings, and Isaac Lucas after they refused to take Covid-19-related pay cuts.

item.title: Author Michael Rosen out of intensive care, wife says
item.description: The former Children's Laureate was admitted to hospital in London eight weeks ago.

item.title: Berlin WW2 bombing survivor Saturn the alligator dies in Moscow Zoo
item.description: His colourful history included escaping from a zoo and a rumour he once belonged to Adolf Hitler.

item.title: Week in pictures: 16-22 May 2020
item.description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

item.title: How to find a meteorite in Antarctica
item.description: Justin Rowlatt joins a team of scientists looking for small space rocks in Antarctica.

item.title: Iranian Parkour athlete arrested over a rooftop kiss
item.description: Alireza Japalaghy performs life-threatening stunts, but has been detained for 'vulgar acts'.

item.title: Coronavirus: The care home that locked down early
item.description: Despite government pressure to take patients being discharged from hospitals, this care home refused and locked down early.

item.title: Lockdown Lego: The enthusiasts building mini masterpieces
item.description: One family recreated James Bond scenes while others paid homage to festivals and their favourite pub.

item.title: Canada v US: Loon stabs eagle through heart
item.description: The loon, which is on Canada's dollar coin, and the eagle, America's national bird, fought to the death.

item.title: Coronavirus: Eavesdropping on a W1A lockdown Zoom meeting
item.description: The cast and writer of W1A have reunited for a one-off Zoom meeting to "cheer people up" during lockdown.

item.title: Dominic Cummings' lockdown trip - what do we know?
item.description: We look at the detail of the controversy surrounding Boris Johnson's most senior adviser.

item.title: Coronavirus: The advice you would give your pre-lockdown self
item.description: If you could go back to the start of 2020 and give yourself pre-lockdown advice, what would it be?

item.title: Coronavirus: Five things a Covid-19 symptom-tracking app tells us
item.description: A major study suggests cases rose after sports events and two million had the disease at its peak.

item.title: Coronavirus in the Maldives: The couple trapped on never-ending honeymoon
item.description: A Dubai-based couple are still stuck at a deserted resort, more than two months after their wedding.

item.title: Coronavirus: The shops refusing to pay their rent
item.description: As the next quarter's rent falls due, who should pay it while businesses are closed?

item.title: Heinrich Himmler: How a fake stamp led to the Nazi SS leader's capture
item.description: Seventy-five years after his death, the Nazi SS leader's possessions are due to go on display in the UK.

item.title: Nasa SpaceX crew mission cleared to launch
item.description: A review panel finds no technical reason to delay the first US orbital crew launch in nine years.

item.title: Hong Kong security law: What is it and is it worrying?
item.description: A simple guide to the new national security law China has proposed in Hong Kong and why it matters.

item.title: Bayern score five to stay four points clear at top of Bundesliga
item.description: Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich will take a four-point lead into Tuesday's top-of-the-table clash with Borussia Dortmund following victory over Eintracht Frankfurt.

item.title: NBA in talks to resume season at Disney World
item.description: The NBA is in talks to resume the season at Florida's Disney World Resort in late July.

item.title: 'I am the second greatest of all time' - but McGregor vows to be the best before retirement
item.description: Former two-weight UFC champion Conor McGregor says he will surpass Anderson Silva as 'the greatest' UFC of all time by the time he retires.

item.title: Football likely in August, says Scottish FA chief exec Maxwell
item.description: Football is now "likely" to be played in Scotland in August, says Scottish FA chief executive Ian Maxwell.

item.title: Sunday's gossip column: Pogba's agent begins talks with Juventus
item.description: Paul Pogba's agent begins talks with Juventus, Bayern Munich enter race with Manchester United for Jadon Sancho, plus more.

item.title: La Liga can resume from 8 June, says Spain's PM
item.description: La Liga can resume behind closed doors from 8 June, says Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.

item.title: #GoalsAtHome: Your best recreations of Jesse Lingard's 2016 FA Cup final winner
item.description: Match of the Day's Steve Wilson commentates on some of your best attempts at recreating Jesse Lingard's powerful winner for Manchester United in the 2016 FA Cup final.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Can children catch and pass on coronavirus?
item.description: BBC's Health Correspondent Laura Foster explains what we know currently about how children are affected by the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Where do governments borrow money?
item.description: How does it work when a government wants to borrow money, and when does it have to pay it back?

item.title: Where are cases still rising?
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus: How safe are takeaways and supermarket deliveries?
item.description: If coronavirus can be transferred on to surfaces, what are the risks of buying food?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will schools be able to reopen in June?
item.description: There are differing views on whether English schools should reopen in June.

item.title: Coronavirus: Is Latin America the next epicentre?
item.description: New cases have been rising sharply in Brazil and Mexico, along with other countries in the region.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: How much will it cost the UK?
item.description: The pandemic will cost the government hundreds of billions of pounds. Where will it all come from?

item.title: Lockdown update: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions in England?

item.title: Coronavirus: Should I defer going to university? And other questions
item.description: Can you start driving lessons again? and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does contact tracing work and is my data safe?
item.description: Millions in the UK will soon be asked to monitor who they have been near to combat coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Why can some of us meet six people?
item.description: Different policies are down to a number of factors, including geography, science and politics, experts say.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the R number and how is it calculated?
item.description: The number at the heart of the decision whether to lift lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Changes have been announced to guidelines in England on exercise and social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus update: What are the symptoms of coronavirus?
item.description: The BBCâs Laura Foster explains how you can recognise the symptoms of coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask or face covering?
item.description: For the first time, people in England are being advised to wear face coverings in some situations.

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do now?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will I be able to go on holiday?
item.description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

item.title: Coronavirus and hydroxychloroquine: What do we know?
item.description: President Trump says he takes the drug as a preventative measure. But what do we know about its effectiveness?

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on public transport?
item.description: Bus and train operators are reducing services and increasing cleaning.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Loss of taste and smell have been added to the UK's list of coronavirus symptoms.

item.title: Coronavirus: When did care homes go into lockdown?
item.description: Many thousands of care home residents have died from coronavirus, but when were key decisions made?

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown is being lifted across Europe
item.description: As the UK alters its restrictions, how are other European countries reopening after lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: How will the Covid-19 alert system work?
item.description: The threat of Covid-19 in England is to be ranked through a five-level, colour-coded alert system.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Am I allowed to move house?
item.description: The easing of lockdown will affect those who want to buy or sell a home, or rent somewhere new, in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: What powers do the police have?
item.description: Police across the UK now have wide-ranging powers to help fight the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How reopened schools in Denmark keep children safely apart
item.description: What's it like in a school that has re-opened? Denmark and Germany show how it might look.

item.title: Coronavirus bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: "Bubbles" of people we can meet safely may form part of the plans to ease lockdown in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does lockdown easing 'follow the science'?
item.description: Why is England pressing ahead with plans to ease lockdown rules ahead of the rest of the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

item.title: How do I travel to work now?
item.description: Some people are being encouraged to go back to work, but how will they get there?

item.title: How to make your own face mask
item.description: Our guide to different types of face coverings and step-by-step instructions on how to make them.

item.title: Coronavirus R0: What is the R number and why does it matter?
item.description: Experts keep discussing the value of R, but what is it and why does it matter?

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the UK's test, track and trace strategy?
item.description: A guide to the three key parts of the government's coronavirus strategy after lockdowns are eased.

item.title: Coronavirus: Young carers 'turned away' from shops in lockdown
item.description: Fayeth, 13, says she feels like she "gets death stares" while shopping for her mum who has epilepsy.

item.title: Hull school 'sorry' after pupils researched porn homework on web
item.description: Pupils in Hull were assigned pornography homework but not told the internet was banned for research.

item.title: Glastonbury Festival fan paints iconic scenes on body
item.description: Lisa Davies finds an iconic view of the festival, reverses the image and then paints it on her body.

item.title: Coronavirus: Man devises 'cuddle curtain' to hug gran
item.description: Footage of the pair embracing has been viewed millions of times on social media.

item.title: Orphaned deer kid saved from Hatfield Moors fire
item.description: The baby roe deer was found collapsed in shrubs and needed reviving with oxygen.
